Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found in a sugar cane field. She had been shot in the head.

> A transvestite was shot and killed Wednesday night in a rural area of the municipality of Caaporã, on the southern coast of Paraíba. According to MIlitary Police, the victim, found in a cane field next to a distillery, had apparently been 30 years old and the body had several gunshot wounds in the region of the head.
>
> The body was found by a Military Police team after a resident of the rural area of Caaporã called police after hearing several shots of a firearm. "The victim was not known in the area. They said a car was seen shortly before, but it is not possible to say if there is a connection with the murder," said Corporal Morais, of the Independent Military Police Company of Alhandra, who is responsible for the policing of Caaporã.
>
> The body of the [trans woman], who had not been identified as of the morning of Thursday (10), was passed to the experts of the Institute of Scientific Police (IPC) and was referred to the Department of Medicine and Legal Dentistry (Gemol) in João Pessoa for identification. By 6:40 p.m. on Thursday no suspect had been arrested according to the Military Police.

The victim's murder was not recorded on the official TDoR 2014 memorial list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2014.

http://g1.globo.com/pb/paraiba/noticia/2014/07/travesti-e-encontrada-morta-em-canavial-no-litoral-sul-da-paraiba.html

Name: Cristal Celeste (Julio César) Cotrina Fasabi
Description:
The victim was a hair stylist who was found severely beaten around the face, face down with blood stains in their bedroom.

> A stylist identified as Julio César Cotrina Fasabi (21) was found dead inside [their] room in a building located in block 8 of San Martín avenue in Magdalena de Mar.
>
> The corpse of the young [person], who, due to his sexual orientation, called [themself] Cristal Celeste Ramírez del Águila, was found this Monday morning by the residents of the property.
>
> The body of Cotrina Fasabi was found upside down and with blood stains, for which it is presumed that ]they were] murdered.
>
> The owner of the hairdresser where the victim worked expressed surprise and regret upon learning of the fact, while the neighbors described the young [person] as a calm person. 
>
> The prosecutor on the shift who arrived at the building ordered the removal of the body that was taken to the central morgue in Lima, where the causes of death will be determined.

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans

https://rpp.pe/lima/actualidad/estilista-es-hallado-muerto-en-un-edificio-de-magdalena-noticia-707968

https://elcomercio.pe/lima/joven-gay-hallado-muerto-habitacion-magdalena-341581-noticia/

Name: Kellen Santorine
Description:
Kellen was strangled and her body thrown into a motel swimming pool. She was also raped and suffered blunt force trauma.

The killer was apprehended by motel staff when he tried to flee.

> Kellen Santorine, who was [trans], was found dead on Sunday morning (13) in a motel pool in Uberaba, Minas Gerais. Also found at the scene was a 29-year-old EGC mechanic, who tried to escape by jumping over the wall of the establishment.
>
> According to a report in Jornal da Manhã this Monday (14), the Military Police Operations Center was informed at around 6:50 am that a [trans woman] was dead in the swimming pool of one of the suites. There, they found the customer trying to escape.
>
> The suspect in the crime was apparently stunned and initially told that he was kidnapped by a third person, who killed the [trans woman] and threw her into the water. Afterwards, he changed his account and said that he hired the [trans woman] and used various types of drugs at the motel.
>
> He said he did not notice when the victim "drowned" and that he removed the body from the water, alerting the staff. The mechanic had scratches all over his body and a bite mark on his waist, while the victim had ankle injuries and a bite mark on her buttocks. The suite was in disarray.

Kellen was from Corumbá in Mato Grosso do Sul, and had been in Uberaba for a month.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Uipi 14.07.2014

https://www.dailykos.com/stories/2014/11/20/1345807/-Speaking-for-the-Dead-Transgender-Day-of-Remembrance

https://web.archive.org/web/20161223133216/http://acapa.virgula.uol.com.br/politica/travesti-e-encontrada-morta-em-piscina-de-motel-de-minas-gerais-suspeito-e-liberado/2/32/24564

Name: Makelly Castro
Description:
Makelly's naked body was found on waste ground in the early hours of Friday 18th July. She had a garment wrapped around her neck and foam coming from her mouth.

> The trans woman found dead Friday morning in the Industrial District of Teresina was identified by members of  the Piauiense Group of Transsexuals and Transvestites as Makelly Castro, who turned 24 on Wednesday. The coordinator of the group, Maria Laura dos Reis, confirmed that the girl was doing a program in the region of Teresina. 
> 
> "We heard that she left her bike in front of a nightclub near Fripisa square and left with a client. She had been missing since then," he said. 
> 
> Makelly came to live in São Paulo and recently returned to Piauí.

In September 2015 Luis Augusto Antunes, a 31-year-old university professor, was arrested at his home and charged with killing her. However, in October 2017 he was acquitted of qualified homicide, despite being recognised by the court as being her killer.

> The 2nd People's Court of the Jury of Teresina acquitted the journalist and former university professor, Luís Augusto Antunes, accused of the murder of the transvestite [deadname], known as Makelly Castro. The trial took place on Thursday (05).
> 
> According to prosecutor Ubiraci Rocha, he will appeal the sentence because the jury acknowledged the author of the crime by the journalist, but acquitted him of the practice of the crime of qualified homicide: "The Public Prosecutor's Office will appeal for a decision contrary to the evidence of the case and incompatibility in the response to the questions, for recognizing the authorship and absolving the practice of the crime. "
> 
> For the prosecutor, the sentence "demonstrates, unfortunately, the prejudice to the condition of the victim for being [a trans woman]".

In January 2020 an outpatient clinic named after Makelly opened at the Getúlio Vargas Hospital in Teresina.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Cidade Verde  18.07.2014

Name: Tyra Sinclair
Description:
Tyra and her friend [Jada](https://tdor.translivesmatter.info/reports/2014/07/20/jada-john_georgetown-guyana_87f4699d) were both stabbed to death by Samuel Bristol, who then killed himself several hours later.

According to reports, Bristol was the jilted ex-partner of one of their colleagues and was angry because the relationship had been broken off.

> Following last month’s fatal stabbing of two members of the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) community, the Guyana Trans United (GTU) has issued a call for justice for the dead, while decrying media coverage of the tragedy.
>
> [Deadname] John, also known as Jada, and [deadname] Sinclair, called Tyra, were murdered last month by Nabaclis resident Samuel Bristol, who later killed himself.
>
> In a statement issued last week, GTU and victims’ families urged the police to “conduct a thorough and impartial investigation and to bring all the persons involved in these murders to justice.”
>
> These persons, the body said, included the MMC guards who allegedly rescued Bristol from a group of enraged sex workers.

TvT partner organization: Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans

https://www.stabroeknews.com/2014/08/26/news/guyana/transgender-group-calls-justice-double-murder/

https://guyanachronicle.com/2014/07/20/double-murder-and-suicide-rock-gay-community-suspects-mother-unaware-son-was-into-boys/

https://www.inewsguyana.com/man-who-stabbed-gays-to-death-kills-self/
Tweet: Tyra Sinclair was stabbed in Georgetown (Guyana) on 20 Jul 2014. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Dennysi Brandao
Description:
Dennysi was shot 4 times by two men in a car on Avenida Babita Camargos on the morning of Thursday 24th July.

A witness told the military police that trans women in the area had been threatened, and two had been the target of an attack nearby only the previous week.

Dennysi's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/dennysi.brandao.1.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Noticias R7 24.07.2014

Name: Dafine dos Santos Cameiro
Description:
Dafine was walking in the street with another trans person, when two men on a motorbike approached them and shot Dafine to death. They also tried to shot the other trans person, but failed.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & TV Litoral Parana 30.07.2014

Name: Alisson Henrique da Silva ("Pequeno")
Description:
Alisson was shot in the head by two men on a motorcycle as she was drinking in a bar in the Aeroporto district of Juazeiro do Norte.

> The victim got up and ran to try to escape the firing line, but ended up shot with two shots in the head and fell into a house. She was rescued in an ambulance from SAMU to the Regional Hospital of Cariri, but arrived without life.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & O Comunicador 31.07.2014
